thread.title: Five Travel Blogs You Should Be Reading
thread.title_full: Five Travel Blogs You Should Be Reading

author: By Benet Wilson
title: Five Travel Blogs You Should Be Reading
text:
I've been fortunate enough to travel the world, mostly on other people's dimes. But when I can't get away, I read travel blogs to keep up with what others are doing and daydream about the places I still want to see. Every time I read a travel blog, it reminds me of all the travel opportunities still to come for me. Below are five must-read travel blogs I keep on my Flipbook page.
Courtesy of GraphicStock 1. Travel Skills Chris McGinnis and Johnny DiScala (see below) run the #TravelSkills TweetChat every Friday at noon Eastern time. Each week they discuss a different topic, like weather, inflight etiquette and U.S. landmarks and iconic sites. And now McGinnis has created the Travel Skills website, which is chock full of short but informative articles on travel tips, hotels, business travel and deals. More »
Passengers at Los Angeles International Airport. Photo by Benet J. Wilson 2. Stuck at the Airport This blog is run by my airport soul sister Harriet Baskas , a freelance journalist who writes for publications including USA Today Travel , NBC News Travel and the Runway Girl Network . Baskas blogs about topics including airport art, the opening of London Heathrow Airport's Terminal 2 (I was there with her and wrote about it here), and the latest on airport amenities. More »
3. JohnnyJet.com Johnny DiScala is a U.S.-based travel expert and the Editor-in-Chief of JohnnyJet.com, a terrific travel information website. He offers travel tips, hotel and airline deals and wonderful profiles of travel pros. He also provides a weekly travel news roundup featuring the good, the bad and the ugly in the industry. More »
4. Elliott.org Chris Elliott runs a great consumer advocacy/tips blog. If you have trouble with your travels, you can reach out to him and he advocates on behalf of some of the more interesting cases, like this post: What does US Airways owe me for “ruining” my vacation? He also offers travel tips, advice and a great newsletter. More »
5. The Travelling Hungry Boy I have been reading this blog since its beginning in May 2005. He travels the world for his job and enjoys taking photos and offering commentary on local cuisine. And he does include the occasional airline food review. His review of white asparagus season in Germany brought back fond memories of a celebration I attended back in 2001 as the guest of now-defunct aircraft manufacturer Fairchild Dornier. More »
